attributes.action: suggest to the Financial Services Authority that they refund the £1,000,000 fine levied against Nationwide Building Society and instead instruct that the fine be paid by those responsible rather than the societies Mutual members
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Several institutions have lost or had stolen laptops and mobile phones with confidential personal information about clients on them (including the FSA itself). Last year, the Financial Services Authority (FSA) fined Nationwide £1m following the theft of a laptop. This was a double penalty to those clients whose date was stolen as Nationwide are a mutual and hence owned by it's depositers (those who'd been offended against!). The FSA should refund the £1m or insist that it is paid for by those senior staff in Nationwide who failed in their duty of care to their members.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
